Job Title: Transportation Engineer Specialist

Location: Frankfort, KY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Advertisement Closes

4/23/2024 (8:00 PM EDT)

24-02389

Transportation Engineer Specialist

Pay Grade 18

Salary

$6,880.26 - $7,453.88 Monthly

Employment Type

EXECUTIVE BRANCH | FULL TIME | INELIGIBLE FOR OVERTIME PAY | 18A | 37.5 HR/WK

Click here for more details on state employment.

Hiring Agency

Transportation Cabinet | Department of Highways

Location

200 Mero Street

Frankfort, KY 40622 USA

The agency may authorize the selected applicant to telecommute up to 2-days per week for Kentucky residents only. The agency may terminate or modify the telecommuting arrangement at any time.

Description

The Kentucky Transportation Cabinet is committed to meeting or exceeding the needs and expectations of our customers. Our focus is on people: our customers, our employees, and our partners. We will continually improve both the delivery of our products and services and the processes that support that delivery to provide a safe, efficient, environmentally sound, and fiscally responsible transportation system that delivers economic opportunity and enhances the quality of life in Kentucky.

By joining our Division of Highway Design, Developmental Branch as a TRANSPORTATION ENGINEER SPECIALIST in Franklin County, you’ll have the opportunity to review, analyze and perform intermediately complex engineering activities and work to obtain and develop professional engineering techniques; and perform other duties as assigned.

Holders of the Transportation Engineer Specialist position will complete tasks such as:

Develop survey training / workflows for construction personal.  Work with Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) team to develop best practices / requirements.  Manage survey equipment for construction staff statewide.  Support construction personal statewide.

Holders Of This Job Will Obtain The Following Skills

Assist Transportation Cabinet with technology advancements.  Become an expert in multiple survey softwares.  Leave a lasting impact to the transportation industry as a whole.  Become familiar with tasks of different branches throughout the cabinet.

Desired candidates possess the following requisite skills or experience applicable to the position:

Experience working with KY Transportation Cabinet.  Survey experience.  Strong work ethic and ability to think critically.  Ability to communicate to staff across many branches.

Additional position information (travel required, standing/stooping/bending/lifting, sitting at a desk, etc.):

Traveling to construction sites across the state will be required.  License as a professional engineer by the Kentucky Board of Engineers and Land Surveyors or another state with the ability able to obtain Kentucky licensure within 6-month probation period.  Valid Driver’s License.  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.

The Kentucky Transportation Cabinet (KYTC) participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in U.S. KYTC will only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. For more information on E-Verify, or if you believe that KYTC has violated its E-Verify responsibilities, please contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) at 888-897-7781 or https://www.e-verify.gov/.

If you are looking for a rewarding career with a culture of employee involvement, where teamwork is the norm and measurement of performance is essential, the Kentucky Transportation Cabinet is for you! We look forward to reviewing your application.

Minimum Requirements

EDUCATION: See Special Requirements.

EXPERIENCE, TRAINING, OR SKILLS: Must have four years of engineering experience in addition to that required for licensure as a Professional Engineer.

Substitute EDUCATION for EXPERIENCE: A master's degree in engineering will substitute for one year of the required experience. Graduate work in engineering beyond a master's degree will substitute for the required experience on a year-for-year basis.

Substitute EXPERIENCE for EDUCATION: NONE

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS (AGE, LICENSURE, REGULATION, ETC.): Must possess a valid driver's license prior to employment in this job classification. Must be licensed as a professional engineer by the Kentucky Board of Licensure for Engineers and Land Surveyors OR must be licensed in another state with the ability to obtain a Professional Engineering license from the Kentucky Board of Licensure for Engineers and Land Surveyors within the employee's initial six month probationary period. Engineering decisions recommended by individuals without a Kentucky Professional Engineering License must be approved by a KRS Chapter 322 Licensed Professional Engineer until licensure is obtained. For additional information refer to: http://kyboels.ky.gov/. Must maintain any required licensure(s), certification(s), or other credentials for the length of employment in this job classification. Employing agency is responsible for ensuring employee possesses and maintains required licensure(s), certification(s) or other credentials.

Working Conditions

Work is performed in the office and in the field. Will be exposed to risks inherent to construction sites which require the following of safety procedures.

Probationary Period

This job has an initial and promotional probationary period of 6 months, except as provided in KRS 18A.111.

If you have questions about this advertisement, please contact Matt Sipes at Matthew.Sipes@ky.gov or 502-782-4899.

An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
